thread.title: Labh Janjua cremated at Khanna of Ludhiana district
thread.title_full: Labh Janjua cremated at Khanna of Ludhiana district - The Times of India

author: Shariq Majeed
title: Labh Janjua cremated at Khanna of Ludhiana district
text:
Popular Bollywood singer of 'London thumakda' fame, Labh Janjua was bid a tearful adieu by his family, residents of his native place and many of his colleagues at Khanna where his body was cremated on Friday afternoon. 57-year-old singer had died at his rented accommodation at Goregaon in Mumbai.
Family sources said that on Friday morning at around 11 am, Daljeet Kaur, wife of the singer, brought his dead body by air to Chandigarh airport from where it was rushed to his native place of Khanna. They added that dead body of the reputed singer reached Khanna at around 1.15 pm on Friday after which his final journey to cremation ground in Khanna began from his house at Guru Teg Bahadur Nagar at around 2 pm.
READ: 'Jee Karda' singer Labh Janjua found dead under mysterious circumstances
Popular singer and actor Gurdas Maan, Punjabi singers Sardool Sikander, Sukhshinder Shinda, Jassi Gill among others attended the cremation. Almost everyone who attended the funeral was in tears as Labh's seven-year-old son, Baljinder Singh, whom he had adopted, lighted his body on the pyre.
Speaking to the media, Gurdas Maan, who couldn't speak much, said that Labh had come to his place some time ago. Maan said that Labh was a very social person and simple at heart.
One of the fans of Labh, who attended his last rites, was shocked to see the stitches on his throat because of his post-mortem examination.
